articles.description: In the zoo of monstrous egos that is Hollywood, William Hurt took an almost Zen-like attitude to his profession. “I am not an actor. I am nobody. I don’t exist,” he insisted. “But the work exists. The work is more than the actor.”Never one to under-theorise, …
